snippet.title: Woman dies in South Australian crash
snippet.content: An elderly woman is dead and another is recovering in hospital after a three-car crash in South Australia. Just after 7pm on Tuesday three cars collided on the Port River expressway, with the 77-year-old driver of one of the cars later dying in hospital. Her 79-year-old passenger was take to the Royal Adelaide Hospital hospital with non-life-threatening, but serious, injuries, while the drivers of the two other cars suffered minor injuries. The woman's death takes the state's road toll to 54 compared to 47 for the same time last year. Originally published as
